smell_analysis.justification: All diagrams in the provided file contain elements and are not empty.
All use cases in the diagrams are either directly connected to actors or connected via <<include>> relationships to use cases that are connected to actors.
No instances were found where an actor is associated with multiple use cases having synonymous names.
No packages were found containing multiple elements with the exact same name.

While multiple tables contain similar audit columns (e.g., 'reg_aeg'), these represent entity-specific data rather than redundant copies of the same value. No denormalization lacking foreign keys was detected.
Use case naming appears consistent, following the 'Verb Noun' pattern (e.g., 'Registreeri auto', 'Vaata aktiivseid autosid').
All states in the 'Auto seisundidiagramm' (Page 9) are reachable via transitions.
All actions in the 'Auto lõpetamise tegevusdiagramm' (Page 4) are reachable through the decision flows.

On the 'Autode register (Klassifikaator)' class diagram (Page 12), the association line between the class 'Auto' and the class 'Auto_kütuse_liik' has a multiplicity indicator '1' at the classifier end, but is missing a visible multiplicity indicator (e.g., '0..*') at the 'Auto' end.
No single diagram exceeds the threshold of 10 central elements (classes, tables, use cases, or states). The largest diagrams contain fewer than 10 such elements.
No single class or table displays 6 or more visual connection lines on a single page. The maximum observed is 4 connections for 'Auto' on Page 17.
The layout of elements across all diagrams is reasonably uniform, with no distance between related elements exceeding twice the average.
All use cases and activity actions start with an active verb (e.g., 'Vaata', 'Tuvasta', 'Registreeri', 'Otsi').
No names for classes, tables, attributes, or use cases were found to be 3 characters or less. Shortest names like 'Isik', 'Riik', and 'Auto' are 4 characters long.
Class names consistently start with uppercase letters and are singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto', 'Klient').
On the 'Töötajate register' class diagram (Page 10), the class 'Töötaja_rolli_omamine' contains attributes 'Alguse_aeg' and 'Lõpu_aeg' which incorrectly start with an uppercase letter.
Database table names are consistently singular (e.g., 'Isik', 'Auto', 'Klient').

On the 'Klassifikaatorite register (Auto)' class diagram (Page 7) and related pages, the 'Klassifikaator' class contains attributes with type prefixes: 'bool_on_aktiivne' (boolean), 'chr_nimetus' (char), and 'chr_kood' (char).
